== MacBook 2,1 and Ubuntu 10.04 (Lucid Lynx) ==
<nowiki>[[File:MacBook4-1/Intrepid/MacBooksmall.png]]</nowiki><<BR>><<BR>>

This page aims to describe the steps needed, to fully enable all features of the '''2nd Generation MacBook 2,1''' (release date: late 2006, mid 2007) when using '''Ubuntu 10.04, Lucid Lynx'''.<<BR>>
<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/terminal.png]]</nowiki> You can find out, what model you have by typing at the terminal:<<BR>>
<pre>
sudo dmidecode -s system-product-name
</pre>
<<BR>>
 If you have a different model, please go <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MactelSupportTeam/CommunityHelpPages|here]]</nowiki> and find the right wiki.

=== Basic Installation Instructions ===
Common things about installing and maintaining Ubuntu on Intel-based Macs:
<nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MactelSupportTeam/AppleIntelInstallation|Intel CPU-based Macintosh Generic Installation Instructions]]</nowiki>

=== External Speakers ===

External speakers don't work by default because they are muted.

Install gnome-alsamixer

<pre>
sudo apt-get install gnome-alsamixer
</pre>

Open the mixer from Applications > Sound & Video > GNOME ALSA Mixer and unmute the speaker in the third column.

=== Wireless (AirPort) ===

<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/restricted.png]]</nowiki>

=== Suspend/Hibernate/Power Management ===
You might find that <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1469819|upower crashes]]</nowiki>. The fix is to <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntuproductivity.com/journal/tips/05/2010/battery-always-0-in-ubuntu-10-04/|add 'upower' as a Startup Application command]]</nowiki>. 

This affects Suspend/Hibernate functionality in that the computer will not recognize that the battery has reached a critically low level, ignoring any Suspend or Hibernate rule set in the Power Management Preferences.

=== iSight ===
<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/webcam.png]]</nowiki>

Follow <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MactelSupportTeam/AppleiSight|AppleiSight]]</nowiki>.

=== Touchpad (appletouch) ===

Out of the box, 2 finger tap does right click (contextual menu), and 3 finger tap does a middle click. To have left-middle-right clicks with 1-2-3 finger tap, install <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SynapticsTouchpad#synclient|synclient]]</nowiki>, and reorder the allocation:

<pre>
     synclient   TapButton2=2   TapButton3=3
     synclient ClickFinger2=2 ClickFinger3=3
</pre>

=== Apple Remote Control ===

Works out of the box. Treat like macmini.
<pre>
    sudo apt-get install lirc
### test with
    irw
</pre>

NB the keycodes are very different from what you find in forum threads on the web! ie MENU and not KEY_MENU. So keep this in mind when writing your .lircrc

=== Bluetooth ===
Bluetooth seems to work. After pairing a GPS mouse, you might have to check this page (in german) to make the binding stick: <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntuusers.de/gpsd#Probleme-mit-Bluetooth-GPS-Maeusen]]</nowiki>
